location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 256 of 1837, Commander Felix Jones, Political Agent Persian Field Force to Henry Lacon Anderson, Secretary to Government, Bombay Castle

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has a foliation sequence of a small number in the top right hand corner of each folio.

mods.abstract: This letter encloses two letters and informs Henry Lacon Anderson, that Captain Jones suspects that Shaikh Sultan bin Saggar, chief of Ras al-Khaimah, is intriguing with his Sayyid Turki against his brother, Sayyid Sulaiman for the Imamship of Oman. The first enclosed letter (dated 20 April 1857), from the chief of Ras al-Khaimah, Sheikh Sultan bin Saggar, explains why he wants to launch an attack by sea on the Sheeqaryeen [Shariqiyin]. The second enclosed letter (dated 23 April 1857), from Captain Jones to Sheikh Sultan bin Saggar explains why he cannot agree to an attack by sea.
